bibliographic_metadata.Title: Mineral prospectivity mapping using a joint singularity-based weighting method and long short-term memory network
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Ziye Wang, Renguang Zuo

abstract: This study develops a joint workflow combining a singularity-based weighting method and a long short-term memory (LSTM) network for mineral prospectivity mapping (MPM). The approach evaluates geological features' importance for mineralization and integrates them using LSTM to extract deep geological information. A case study targeting Fe mineralization in southwestern Fujian Province, China, demonstrates the effectiveness of this method, revealing that known Fe deposits are located in high prospective regions identified by the model.
methodology: supervised > deep learning > long short-term memory network (LSTM)

types: Geochemical data; 39 major and trace elements
Geophysical data; Airborne total magnetic intensity; nT

key_points: Developed a joint workflow for mineral prospectivity mapping.
Utilized a singularity-based weighting method for geological features.
Employed a long short-term memory network for data integration.
Case study focused on Fe mineralization in southwestern Fujian Province.
Model predictions aligned closely with known Fe deposit locations.
